alert.note: Alert for Orange (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 09 at 7:49PM EST until January 09 at 10:15PM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT EST TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of central and northwest Virginia, including the following counties, in central Virginia, Greene and Orange. In northwest Virginia, Madison. * WHEN...Until midnight EST tonight. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 749 PM EST, The river gauge along the Robinson River in Locust Dale indicated that flooding was ongoing and that river levels continue to rise. Additionally, the Hazel River near Rixeyville is on the rise, but remains below flood stage at this time. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Flooding impacts will continue, but no additional rainfall is expected. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Orange... Madison... Stanardsville... Big Meadows... Gordonsville... Ruckersville... Brightwood... Aroda... Twymans Mill... Oakpark... Pratts... Rochelle... Madison Mills... Locust Dale... Montford... Shelby... Montpelier Station... Old Somerset... Somerset... Fordsville... - Please visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for flood safety and preparedness information
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
